Unless you're involved with utilities' engineering, management or equipment sales, you probably can't define the term smart grid,'' said Teresa Hansen, editor in chief of Electric Light& Power magazine. The average person hears about smart meters when his or her electric utility announces installations, and usually that information gets mailed along with utility bills. I think electricity consumers-nearly everyone in the United States-would appreciate learning more about the smart grid from the people they already trust: their favorite journalists in print, on TV, radio and online. Smart grid's ready to go mainstream.
